name: muddily
content:
muddily adverb
(LIKE OR CONTAINING MUD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is covered by, containing, or like mud (= wet, sticky earth): The river flowed slowly and muddily past his farm.
More examplesFewer examplesHe swallowed the rest of his coffee, which was muddily warm and thick.Autumn was turning muddily into winter.

muddily adverb
(NOT CLEARLY)
in a way that is confusing or not clear: The scenes were linked muddily together. The details of what happened were muddily explained. Synonyms
confusingly
unclearly
More examplesFewer examplesThe plot muddily spins all over the place.The music is muddily recorded in places.

muddily adverb
(COLOURS)
in a way that is dark and not bright: The room had a muddily washed-out look. They entered the muddily decorated cafe and found a table. Synonym
drably
More examplesFewer examplesThe feathers were plain and muddily coloured.
